page.title: 10HAM LANDS
page.content: {Ham Lands }is an area of uncultivated grassland.It is bordered by the Wates estate, the River Thames,Teddington footbridge and the Thames Young Mariners.Until 1900 the land was farmed.From 1990-1950 it was a gravel pit. It was then filled in with rubbish from all around London and covered with top soil from Buckinghamshire. Ham Lands today is grassland with tall trees like ash, sycamore, horse-chestnut,oak,willow and poplar and bushes like hawthorn, blackthorn, blackberry and wild rose.There are many different types of flowers,birds and insects.There are also foxes and badgers.Richmond Council looks after the land by cutting the grass once a year and by providing paths.
